patterns.response: Hello! I am the Tamil Nadu Police Assistant. How can I help you?
For emergency assistance, please call 100 immediately. We will help you.

To file an FIR (First Information Report), you can visit the nearest police station or file it online through the Tamil Nadu Police website. You will need to provide details about the incident, including date, time, location, and description of what happened.
For cases of eve teasing or harassment, you can file a complaint at the nearest police station or call the Women's Helpline at 1091. The police will take immediate action to ensure your safety.
To file a complaint, you can visit the nearest police station or file it online through the Tamil Nadu Police website. For emergency situations, call 100 immediately.
To find the nearest police station, you can use the Police Station Locator on the Tamil Nadu Police website or call 100 for assistance.
To obtain a police certificate, visit your nearest police station with required documents and submit an application. The process usually takes 7-10 working days.
For traffic-related issues, you can contact the Traffic Police at 103 or visit the nearest traffic police station. You can also pay traffic fines online through the Tamil Nadu Police website.
For cyber crime complaints, you can file a report at the nearest cyber crime police station or through the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal. Call 1930 for cyber crime helpline.
Thank you! Please contact us again if you need any further assistance.
